snippet: The attack on a rebel-held Syrian village reportedly sickened more than 100 people.
abstract: Syrian state television and antigovernment activists report that poison gas was used in rebel-held village in the central province of Hama; each side blames its enemies for an attack they both say sickened more than 100 people.

byline.original: By ANNE BARNARD and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Mohammad Ghannam and Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Beirut, and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: The attack on a rebel-held Syrian village reportedly sickened more than 100 people.

headline.main: Damascus and Rebels Trade Blame in Gas Attack
headline.print_headline: Damascus and Rebels Trade Blame in Gas Attack

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
